content.description: Start standing on the good horizontal seam on the left side of Mike's Face.  Climb straight up to the same stance as Unknown V3, but instead of cutting left, head straight up (and very slightly right) on thin but positive grips to the apex of the boulder.  May be harder if you are shorter and unable to reach a key crimp off the low feet.
content.protection: Two pads work, and you can step off before the point of commitment--but missing the pads and landing in the talus would be bad!
content.location: East-most side of the north face of Mike's Face.

content.description:
Start on the problem just left of Mike's Face(AKA Spike).  A few moves on small edges gains a good edge in the middle of the face.  Instead of continuning up, cut left using the rib features to head over the boulder leaning against the face. Top out once you get to the good holds.

Feels a little scary but you can step off at any moment.

Sit start low in the bottom of the pit on a double hand undercling. Traverse the good features up and right until pulling over the bulge and onto the slab. Don't top out to early ;)... Stay on the face and climb straight up the slab to the top using only the holds on the slabs face. Do not use the left arete/ lip. Great warm up! Also be sure to check out the big "party room" cave just to the right of the start.
content.protection:
Crash Pads

Don't fall... very sketchy, death pit, landing!
content.location: This problem is located on the south face of the "Mikes Face"/ "No Fear" boulder. It is north of the "Black Roof Boulders". Right across from "Physicality" v7. Look for a slab with a deep pit below it.

content.description:
Name/history of this traverse is unknown.  Start sitting on the far right side of the Mike's Face bloc.  Follow the thin seam left on thin, technical moves to at least four potential finishes (1) up Mike's Face (easiest), (2) up Skat B's left-trending diagonal variation (harder), (3) up Unknown Direct (harder), (4) or up Unknown Left (perhaps easier, but I find this line rather cryptic).  Video of traverse into Unknown Direct

here

. Proposed V7 grade is for traverse into Unknown Direct. Easier finishes may bring the grade down to V5/V6, but likely not below that.
content.protection: Pads for finish; scratch pads work for the starting traverse.
content.location: Far west side of north face of Mike's Face Boulder.

content.description: Climbs the thin edges on the north face above a small spiky flake at knee height.
content.location: North face of the boulder facing another smaller boulder pit.
